glsa.title: mod_auth_pgsql: Multiple format string vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Format string vulnerabilities in mod_auth_pgsql may lead to the execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: mod_auth_pgsql is an Apache2 module that allows user authentication against a PostgreSQL database.

description.p: The error logging functions of mod_auth_pgsql fail to validate certain strings before passing them to syslog, resulting in format string vulnerabilities.

impact.p: An unauthenticated remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code with the rights of the user running the Apache2 server by sending specially crafted login names.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All mod_auth_pgsql users should upgrade to the latest version:
